other_tests.findings: Normal levels of protein and glucose, an erythrocyte count of 21, and no pleocytosis. The immunoglobulin G index was elevated at 696 mg/L.
Normal except for rudimentary sleep structures.
Detected a D178N/129M mutation in the prion protein gene, confirming the diagnosis of fatal familial insomnia (FFI).
Weak immunoreactivity of the prion protein in granular deposits restricted to neurons in the thalamus.
Confirmed the presence of scrapie protease K resistant protein (PrPsc).
